locutie.beschrijving: The sermon contrasts the 'virtual' nature of modern technology (Internet, TV, movies) with the physical, historical, and sacramental reality of Jesus' incarnation and the Eucharist. It uses the Kosovo war as a backdrop for human helplessness.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Connects the institution of the Lord's Supper with the Exodus narrative and the theology of the Cross (Phil 2).

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from asserting the reality of Christ's presence to declaring the new status of the congregation as 'family' and 'friends' of God.
voorbeelden: I am making some connections that are theologically and ethically suggestive.
You are my friends.
This is my body, given for you.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from being a spectator (virtual) to a participant in the body of Christ (real).
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicit. 'I am hoping that the Holy Spirit is working in some way tonight...'

voorbeelden: Jesus did not just come among us as an observer.
God has gone online.
We are all hostages to sin and death.
Listen again to the words of Paul.
Imagine, if you will, a huge military force.
Take, eat.
I am just raising some questions.
I am only disturbed, as all Christians should be.
I donâ€™t know what was more affecting.
He will not let us be his enemies.
God sent himself [as a rescue].
commissieven.kwaliteit: Implicit but strong; the promise is embedded in the narrative of God's personal involvement.

voorbeelden: We are family tonight.
You are my friends.
This is my body, given for you.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High. The preacher speaks on behalf of Christ in the final address.

indicatoren: Extensive cultural commentary on the Internet and movies.
Long political analysis of the Kosovo conflict.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually engaged but remains an observer for the first two-thirds of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Immediate present-tense promises earlier in the text
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens at the very end.

voorbeelden: He will not let us be his enemies.
You are my friends.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and homiletical 'I' (I am making connections).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation, especially regarding their presence in the pews.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to bridge the gap between the 'virtual' and the 'real' presence.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Discussing Jesus, God, the Internet, and Kosovo.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that is only closed in the final section.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General observations about technology and human nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Tonight' aspect of the Maundy Thursday liturgy.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (The problem of virtuality/sin) -> Declarative (We are family/You are friends) -> Directive (Take, eat).
voorbeelden: Jesus came to share our space... You are my friends... Take, eat.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent transition from the 'indicative' of Christ's work to the 'declarative' of the hearer's new status.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: But he will not let us be his enemies. [Indicative] ... Take, eat [Imperative].

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a heavy constative start, the sermon successfully culminates in a sacramental event where the words perform what they signify.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The contrast between the 'SWAT team' and God's personal involvement.
sterke_punten.effect: Makes the incarnation visceral and non-abstract.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on Netscape and the Wall Street Journal.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Risks becoming a social commentary lecture.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon moves from 'talking about' to 'addressing' in the final third, effectively turning the service into an encounter.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'You are my friends' functions as a powerful declarative act.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, especially in the conclusion where the preacher's voice merges with Christ's.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Clearly assumed in the final invitation.
tekstueel_bewijs: Here he is tonight... asking nothing of you at all except that you come.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher explicitly hopes the Spirit works through the images provided.
tekstueel_bewijs: I am hoping that the Holy Spirit is working in some way tonight.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is the 'proclamation' that makes the presence 'real' rather than 'virtual'.
tekstueel_bewijs: This is not virtual reality tonight. This is the real thing.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon relies heavily on descriptive 'to be' verbs in the first half; it needs more 'I-Thou' performative verbs earlier.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Bible summons us to a lifetime of study.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, the Word of God summons you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth (constative) to a present address (directive/performative).

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: The ending is already very strong.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much third-person 'he' and 'they' in the middle section.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the 'you' of the congregation into the Kosovo/Refugee analogy sooner.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the ones for whom He became a refugee.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of using cultural critique to clear the ground for a truly performative sacramental moment.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about her feelings on the war; SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the words to create a new family.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: It is not just persuasive; it claims to actually 'bring into being' the relationships it describes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is not in the Kosovo illustrations themselves, but in the shift from Assertive (talking about refugees) to Commissive (God's promise to his enemies).

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic 'Toezegging' (Promise) model.
